The chromosomal change responsible for the disorder typically occurs as a random event during the formation of reproductive cells (eggs or sperm) in a parent of the affected individual, usually the mother. Most affected individuals have no history of the disorder in their family. However, rare inherited cases of tetrasomy 18p have been reported.",GHR,tetrasomy 18p
What are the treatments for tetrasomy 18p ?,"These resources address the diagnosis or management of tetrasomy 18p:  - Chr
